Tucson's patience with Nightstrike wears thin.  He transforms into his SUV =
mode and follows his signal via sonar equipment.  For the first time he spi=
ns his tires in anger with the intent to do whatever it took to stop Nights=
trike in his tracks, even if it meant putting him under the treads of his t=
ires!

"He wants to play hardball?!  HE'S NOT THE ONLY BOT WHO KNOWS THAT G=
AME! HOW'BOUT IT HUH?! TWO LEGS AGAINST FOUR WHEELS?!  YOU WANT ROUGH YOU G=
OT ROUGH!"

The built up rage that he held against the Decepticons is sudde=
nly released in this one moment where he is once again threatened by enemy =
forces. It was clear that the trauma of what happened to him years ago, had=
 still not left his directory.  Although he had done very well to hide his =
rage, it had not yet left him completely.  His speedometer goes from zero t=
o eighty five miles per hour within moments, as his stick shift goes from p=
ark to drive!  His headlights go from normal to high as he shines the light=
 right on Nightstrike, as a result of his sudden snap in moods.

His course=
 is set, and stays dead on his quarry.  Exhaust fumes begin to fill the roo=
m from his duel exhaust system.  This was it, he was going to win this batt=
le no matter what.  That's if he could catch Nightstrike.

> Being blind for so=
 long had served Tucson very well. No only could he hear what was coming at=
 him, he could also feel it. Again this ability serves him, as he manages t=
o dodge the enemy fire and respond by using another sonar wave thrown at Ni=
ghtstrike, quickly picking up on his distance, location and energy signatur=
e. 
> 
> "Now this is more like it! Nice try, now it's my turn!"
> 
> His h=
and is quick at loading the plasma tipped arrows, and within seconds begins=
 to carefully aim and fire at Nightstrike. His sonar systems also pick up t=
he signatures in other rooms, as he soon finds out that Nightstrike isn't t=
he only adversary in the base.
> 
> " Ravenchief, Guardia, there's somethin=
g else in the next room. Check it out, I don't think it's friendly. Talon, =
I need you to do a sweep of the other chambers inside this base, I'll do wh=
at I can to fend off whoever is firing at us." 
> 
> Like a true Autobot, T=
ucson stands his ground firmly. He continues to implement his sonar equipme=
nt and catches each and every move Nightstrike makes. As he moves, he decip=
hers how close or how far he is from Nightstrike, by the frequency of the p=
ings he hears through his sonar system. Each wave he sends off, the pings c=
ome back more frequently and louder. Until he finds himself right behind Ni=
ghtsrike. He pokes his shoulder to let him know that there was no hiding fr=
om this bot, even though he was visually impaired.
> 
> " Tag, you're it."
=
